intro: Cancrinia krascheninnikovii, commonly known as the Krascheninnikov's sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in desert and steppe environments. Due to its resilience to harsh conditions, it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
